site_name: Morley House314-322 Regent StreetLondonW1B 3BB
description: Amendments to planning permission dated 30 March 2017 (RN: 16/10286) for variation of conditions 1 and 9 and removal of condition 3.2 of planning permission dated 28 April 2016 (15/07483/FULL) for: Demolition and redevelopment behind retained Regent Street and Little Portland Street frontages (Nos. 11-12), including rebuilding of mansard roof, to provide retail floorspace at part ground and basement floors and 44 residential dwellings at first to seventh floor levels, with ground floor entrance and ancillary residential at part basement; erection of plant at roof (seventh floor) level, and external terraces to some flats on rear elevations - namely, to vary the approved drawings numbers to allow changes to the approved dwelling mix, changes to internal layouts including the introduction of a residential amenity space at ground floor level and alterations to the exterior of the building; to vary condition 9 to allow relocation of waste storage and to remove Condition 3.2 which required the submission of details showing retention of marble columns, NAMELY, the installation of a key clamp balustrade in front of the door to the plant area on the south facade at seventh floor level, amendments to the detailed design of the balustrading of the penthouse at 6th and 7th floor levels and the installation of lapped (rather than ashlar) vertical hung Westmorland slate on the north and east (rear) facades.
